org.trimou.engine.locator

Class ClassPathTemplateLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.trimou.engine.config.AbstractConfigurationAware
      • org.trimou.engine.locator.AbstractTemplateLocator
        • org.trimou.engine.locator.PathTemplateLocator<String>
          • org.trimou.engine.locator.ClassPathTemplateLocator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurationAware, TemplateLocator, WithPriority

    public class ClassPathTemplateLocator
extends PathTemplateLocator<String>
    Classpath template locator. There is a special ClassPathTemplateLocator.Builder for convenience.

    Note that for a WAR archive, the classpath root is WEB-INF/classes (other parts of the archive are not available). Consider using org.trimou.servlet.locator.ServletContextTemplateLocator from the trimou-extension-servlet.

    By default, the locator will attempt to scan the classpath to get all available template identifiers. However, only roots representing a directory on a filesystem will be processed. The scanning of JARs and other sources is not trivial. Moreover, it's legal for JARs to have no directory entries at all. Scanning can be entirely disabled - see also ClassPathTemplateLocator.Builder.setScanClasspath(boolean).

    Author:
    Martin Kouba

        Description copied from interface: TemplateLocator
        The reader is always closed by the engine right after the template source is read.
        Parameters:
        templateId - The template identifier
        Returns:
        the reader object for a template with the given name or null if no available template with the given name exists

      • getAllIdentifiers

        public Set<String> getAllIdentifiers()
        Description copied from interface: TemplateLocator
        This method should return an empty set if it's not possible to collect the names/identifiers.
        Returns:
        the set of names of all available template identifiers (i.e. all available templates)
